alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Southern Plymouth; Western Plymouth (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 06 at 3:58AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS MAY RESULT IN SLIPPERY TRAVEL THIS MORNING IN THE VICINITY OF THE WEYMOUTH TO PLYMOUTH CORRIDOR AS WELL AS CAPE ANN... Snow showers this morning across Cape Ann and parts of the South Shore should result in light snow accumulations on roadways, like Routes 3 and 128, as well as briefly poor visibility. These snow showers should come to an end in most locations by this afternoon. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches are possible, with perhaps some localized 3 inch amounts. This may result in some slippery travel for the morning commute. The area of greatest concern is in the vicinity of the Route 3 corridor from Weymouth to Plymouth, as well as outer Cape Ann.
